content: Given the amount of people interested, some sort of parasocial media is probably going to work best. a twitch/youtube stream sounds great
The idea is not to be a lecture, so they probably won't do it
it can be a Q/A session streamed live, not necessarily a lecture
if given the choice between leaving interested people out and using stream chat instead of a live meeting, i would much prefer the latter

Hamza said:

how does streaming on youtube sound?

They will not be recorded, that isn't the format for this club. Go watch JonHoo for other Rust content!
some kind of "Streaming" platform seems like the only way to support so many people, but honestly handling >100 people in a twitch stream is a dedicated skill itself

Hamza said:

if given the choice between leaving interested people out and using stream chat instead of a live meeting, i would much prefer the latter

Whats wrong with splitting it into smaller groups though, to keep the interactive format intact?

Sönke Liebau said:

Whats wrong with splitting it into smaller groups though, to keep the interactive format intact?

There aren't enough experts in any given part of the compiler to lead multiple rooms.
it could be a rotating format, each session is about a different part of the compiler with a local expert leading the session
